segment.source: How to Remove an Application Group
segment.target: How to Remove an Application Group

segment.source: How to Remove an Application Group
segment.target: How to Remove an Application Group

segment.source: How to Remove an Application Group
segment.target: How to Remove an Application Group

segment.source: You can use the following procedures to remove an application group in the Application Virtualization Server Management Console in one of two ways:
segment.target: You can use the following procedures to remove an application group in the Application Virtualization Server Management Console in one of two ways:

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: Deleting a group with its applications deletes those applications from the Application Virtualization Management Server.
segment.target: Deleting a group with its applications deletes those applications from the Application Virtualization Management Server.

segment.source: When you try to do this, you must confirm the deletion in a pop-up window.
segment.target: When you try to do this, you must confirm the deletion in a pop-up window.

segment.source: To empty and then delete an application group
segment.target: To empty and then delete an application group

segment.source: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, expand Applications in the left pane and select the Application group you want to remove.
segment.target: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, expand Applications in the left pane and select the Application group you want to remove.

segment.source: In the right pane, select the applications and application groups you want to keep.
segment.target: In the right pane, select the applications and application groups you want to keep.

segment.source: You can use the CTRL and Shift keys to select multiple applications and application groups.
segment.target: You can use the CTRL and Shift keys to select multiple applications and application groups.

segment.source: Right-click the selected applications, and choose Move.
segment.target: Right-click the selected applications, and choose Move.

segment.source: In the Select Target window, navigate to the new location and click OK.
segment.target: In the Select Target window, navigate to the new location and click OK.

segment.source: Repeat this step if you want to move different applications to more than one group.
segment.target: Repeat this step if you want to move different applications to more than one group.

segment.source: When you finish moving the applications you want to keep, right-click the application group and choose Delete.
segment.target: When you finish moving the applications you want to keep, right-click the application group and choose Delete.

segment.source: Click Yes to confirm.
segment.target: Click Yes to confirm.

segment.source: To delete the group, with all its child groups and its applications
segment.target: To delete the group, with all its child groups and its applications

segment.source: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, expand Applications in the left pane.
segment.target: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, expand Applications in the left pane.

segment.source: Right-click the application group you want to remove, and choose Delete.
segment.target: Right-click the application group you want to remove, and choose Delete.

segment.source: Click Yes to confirm.
segment.target: Click Yes to confirm.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can select and remove multiple application groups simultaneously.
segment.target: You can select and remove multiple application groups simultaneously.

segment.source: In the right pane, use the CTRL-click or Shift-click key combinations to select more than one group.
segment.target: In the right pane, use the CTRL-click or Shift-click key combinations to select more than one group.
